intro: Moquilea rufa, commonly known as the red moquilea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and often edible seeds. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, powdery coating. Moquilea rufa is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils.
